attributes.action: Reverse the VAT cut and invest the returns in cutting the public debt and stopping public spending cuts
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The VAT cut that was revealed in the Pre-budget report last year was ineffectual and little more than a publicity stunt by a government that doesn't know what to do about the 'economic slowdown'/ recession.  The 2.5% cut has hardly helped any consumers, and certainly has done little to boost retail sector.  Why would you buy an item simply because instead of £100 it is now £97.87?  Instead the government is loosing vital income, that could be used to cut the public debt (of £775 billion - April 2009 - or £12,574 per person) and thus stop some of the inevitable public spending cuts that will be coming our way in the following years.  In the next few years we have a choice of higher taxes or lower public spending, and surely a VAT cut which we have hardly noticed yet the budget badly can't afford is not the way to go.
